assetIdentification.assetDescription: The Camera System Integration function manages and processes video data from multiple vehicle cameras (rear view, surround view, driver monitoring) to provide situational awareness information to the driver and to various driver assistance functions. It handles camera feed selection, processing, and display to appropriate vehicle systems, enabling features such as parking assistance, lane keeping, collision avoidance, and driver monitoring.

damageScenarios.title: Visual Misinformation
damageScenarios.description: Falsified or manipulated camera feeds mislead the driver or ADAS systems into making incorrect decisions based on fabricated visual information. This could include hiding obstacles, creating phantom objects, altering lane markings, or distorting distance perception, potentially leading to collisions or unsafe driving maneuvers.

safety.description: Collisions with objects, pedestrians, or other vehicles due to incorrect visual information could cause severe injuries or fatalities.

financial.description: Vehicle damage, potential liability claims, and recall costs if the issue affects multiple vehicles.

operational.description: Reduced trust in driver assistance features, potential need for operational restrictions on affected systems.

privacy.description: Minimal privacy impact unless combined with other attacks targeting driver monitoring cameras.

regulatory.description: Potential non-compliance with vehicle safety regulations if driver assistance features provide incorrect information.

reputational.description: Significant damage to brand reputation if safety-critical camera systems are compromised, especially if resulting in accidents.

damageScenarios.asilJustification: Safety-critical function where manipulation could directly lead to severe injuries or fatalities with reasonable probability, especially in parking or lane keeping scenarios.

damageScenarios.title: Camera System Unavailability
damageScenarios.description: Complete or partial loss of camera functionality when needed for critical driving operations, such as reversing, parking, or lane changes. This could result in the driver operating the vehicle without necessary visual information or ADAS functions being unable to receive critical visual inputs.

safety.description: Potential for collisions when camera functions are unavailable during reversing or parking, though drivers may revert to manual observation.

financial.description: Warranty claims and service costs, though limited compared to more severe scenarios.

operational.description: Drivers may be unable to use vehicle functions that depend on camera input or may need to operate with reduced functionality.

privacy.description: No privacy impact from system unavailability.

regulatory.description: Non-compliance with regulations that mandate rear-view camera functionality during reversing.

reputational.description: Degradation of customer satisfaction and trust in vehicle reliability and technology.

damageScenarios.asilJustification: System unavailability could lead to hazardous situations, particularly during reversing, but drivers typically have alternative means to observe surroundings.

damageScenarios.title: Calibration Parameter Corruption
damageScenarios.description: Corruption of camera calibration parameters causing distorted visual information, incorrect distance measurements, or misaligned overlay graphics (such as parking guidelines). This could lead to unsafe driving decisions based on inaccurate spatial perception.

safety.description: Incorrect distance perception or misaligned guidance could lead to collisions, though typically at low speeds in parking scenarios.

financial.description: Costs related to vehicle damage in low-speed incidents and service visits to recalibrate systems.

operational.description: Reduced effectiveness of parking assistance and other camera-based features, potentially causing driver confusion.

privacy.description: No privacy impact from calibration issues.

regulatory.description: Minor compliance issues if calibration errors affect mandated functionality.

reputational.description: Customer dissatisfaction with apparent poor quality of camera systems and driver assistance features.

damageScenarios.asilJustification: Calibration issues typically manifest in controlled, low-speed scenarios where drivers have more time to react and verify visual information.

damageScenarios.title: Driver Privacy Exposure
damageScenarios.description: Unauthorized access to and extraction of driver monitoring camera data, potentially revealing personal information, biometric data, or behavior patterns of the vehicle occupants.

safety.description: No direct safety impact from privacy breaches alone.

financial.description: Potential regulatory fines for privacy violations, especially under GDPR or similar regulations.

operational.description: Limited operational impact unless privacy concerns lead to disabling of driver monitoring features.

privacy.description: Severe privacy violation as driver monitoring cameras capture facial information and potentially sensitive behaviors inside the vehicle.

regulatory.description: Significant non-compliance with data protection regulations such as GDPR, potentially resulting in investigations and penalties.

reputational.description: Major reputational damage if a manufacturer is perceived as failing to protect occupant privacy, especially for in-cabin monitoring.

damageScenarios.asilJustification: Privacy breaches do not directly affect functional safety, though they are subject to other regulatory frameworks.

damageScenarios.title: False ADAS Activation
damageScenarios.description: Artificial injection of false objects or hazards into camera feeds causing unwarranted activation of automatic emergency braking, evasive steering, or other ADAS interventions, potentially creating traffic hazards or collisions due to unexpected vehicle behavior.

safety.description: Unexpected emergency braking or steering could cause rear-end collisions or loss of vehicle control, potentially at high speeds on highways.

financial.description: Significant costs from vehicle damages, injury claims, recalls, and extensive investigations.

operational.description: Potential deactivation of ADAS features across vehicle fleets while issues are investigated, degrading vehicle capabilities.

privacy.description: No privacy impact from false ADAS activations.

regulatory.description: Potential formal investigations by transportation safety agencies and regulatory authorities.

reputational.description: Severe brand damage from perception that automated systems are dangerous or unpredictable, potentially affecting market position.

damageScenarios.asilJustification: Unintended interventions could occur at high speeds with little warning, potentially causing severe injuries or fatalities, particularly if occurring in dense traffic or causing multi-vehicle incidents.

dataSensitivity.justification: Camera systems process and store visual data from the vehicle's surroundings and potentially the cabin interior, which may contain personally identifiable information, especially from driver monitoring cameras.

operationalCriticality.justification: Camera systems are essential for multiple safety-critical functions including reversing assistance, parking, lane keeping, and collision avoidance.

externalExposure.justification: While camera systems primarily operate on internal networks, they may have connectivity to infotainment systems and software update mechanisms that increase potential attack surface.

attackSurface.justification: Camera systems have various interfaces including hardware connections, data buses, and processing software that could potentially be targeted.

replacementCost.justification: Replacement or repair of camera systems involves moderate costs including hardware, calibration, and potential software updates.

assetValueAssessment.valueJustification: The Camera System Integration is a high-value asset due to its critical role in safety functions, the sensitivity of the data it processes (particularly from driver monitoring cameras), and its significant integration with other vehicle systems. Compromises could have severe safety, privacy, and reputational impacts.

cybersecurityGoals.title: Camera Feed Integrity
cybersecurityGoals.description: The Camera System Integration shall ensure the integrity of all camera feeds to prevent display of falsified or manipulated visual information.

cybersecurityGoals.title: Camera System Availability
cybersecurityGoals.description: The Camera System Integration shall maintain availability of critical camera functions during safety-relevant operations such as reversing and parking.

cybersecurityGoals.title: Calibration Data Protection
cybersecurityGoals.description: The Camera System Integration shall protect calibration parameters from unauthorized modification to ensure accurate visual representation and measurements.

cybersecurityGoals.title: Driver Monitoring Privacy
cybersecurityGoals.description: The Camera System Integration shall protect the privacy of driver monitoring data from unauthorized access or extraction.

cybersecurityGoals.title: ADAS Intervention Security
cybersecurityGoals.description: The Camera System Integration shall prevent the injection of false objects that could trigger unwarranted ADAS interventions.

Data protection by design and by default

The Camera System shall maintain availability during safety-critical operations
The Camera System shall protect calibration data from unauthorized modification

keyTerms.Impact Analysis: Evaluation of potential consequences from cybersecurity incidents
keyTerms.ASIL: Automotive Safety Integrity Level - classification scheme for safety requirements in road vehicles
keyTerms.FMEA: Failure Mode and Effects Analysis - systematic approach for identifying potential failures
keyTerms.RPN: Risk Priority Number - product of severity, occurrence, and detection ratings in FMEA
keyTerms.ADAS: Advanced Driver Assistance Systems - electronic systems that assist drivers in driving and parking functions
keyTerms.Surround View: 360-degree view around the vehicle created by combining multiple camera feeds
keyTerms.Driver Monitoring: System that tracks driver attention, gaze, and alertness using an interior-facing camera
keyTerms.Calibration Parameters: Settings that ensure camera images are properly aligned and distances are accurately represented

contentSummary: This TARA Impact Analysis document evaluates potential cybersecurity incidents affecting the Camera System Integration function, which processes data from multiple vehicle cameras to support driver awareness and ADAS functions. The analysis identifies five key damage scenarios: (1) Visual Misinformation - falsified camera feeds causing incorrect driving decisions; (2) Camera System Unavailability - loss of critical visual information during maneuvers; (3) Calibration Parameter Corruption - distorted visual information affecting spatial perception; (4) Driver Privacy Exposure - unauthorized access to in-cabin monitoring data; and (5) False ADAS Activation - injected visual hazards triggering unwarranted emergency responses. Each scenario is assessed across six impact dimensions (safety, financial, operational, privacy, regulatory, and reputational) with corresponding ASIL classifications and FMEA risk ratings. The Camera System Integration is rated as a high-value asset due to its safety-critical functions and data sensitivity. Based on the damage scenarios, five cybersecurity goals are established to protect system integrity, availability, calibration accuracy, privacy, and ADAS security. The document provides a structured foundation for subsequent threat scenario analysis and risk assessment phases, helping prioritize security measures based on potential impact severity.
